cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with the security aspects of the Index Coding with Side Information (ICSI) problem, which involves the transmission of messages over a network with side information available at the receivers. This problem is relevant to several areas of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), cryptography (cs.CR), network security (cs.NI), signal processing (cs.SI), and distributed systems (cs.DS). Given that the paper focuses on the security aspects of the problem, cs.CR and cs.NI are likely to be the most relevant sub-categories. However, the paper also involves the study of linear index codes and their properties, which are relevant to cs.IT and cs.SI. Finally, the paper deals with the optimization of index codes, which is relevant to cs.DS.
